subtitle: Company Description
body: null Job Description.

Ubisoft Halifax is looking for a new addition to our Programming Team! As a Junior Gameplay Developer, you will work closely with our game team to implement and maintain new game features, third party SDKs and gameplay-related systems.
Our Studio is looking for an enthusiastic developer who loves games as much as the technology that drives them.

This person will integrate their demonstrated track record of curiosity, ingenuity, and personal development into a small, diverse and close-knit team where a good sense of humour and a positive attitude is extremely important.

subtitle: Key Responsibilities
body: Meeting time commitments to develop and/or optimize gameplay features on mobile projects within Unity.
Designing and implementing efficient and maintainable code in C#.
Inspecting, improving and maintaining legacy code and systems.
Communicating implementation decisions both verbally and in documentations to key stakeholders.
Implementing game features, building prototypes and implementing new design concepts for internal testing;.
Effectively recognize and prioritize tasks that require immediate attention throughout the development cycle.

subtitle: Qualifications
body: Demonstrable skills using Unity to develop on both Android and iOS platfroms;.
Experience working with Unity animations and models in 3D Space.
A strong familiarity with Object-Oriented skills and proficiency in C# programming;.
A demonstrated ability with building and deploying an application from Code to Device on mobile platforms.
The ability to work autonomously as well as within a team.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
A demonstrated interest in self-improvement, skill development and the ability to take direction while working within a team.
The ability to Install and work with third-party SDK's and packages within Unity.

subtitle: Experience And Educational Requirements
body: A BSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent;.
Ideally, at least one year of working experience with software/game development.

subtitle: Bonus Qualifications
body: Shipped a game, app or demo on iOS or Android.
Any direct experience working within the Games Industry alongside a team.
Experience in cross-platform development.
Experience maintaining code performance through profiling and optimization.
Scripting Languages (LUA, Python, etc.

subtitle: Ubisoft Offers
body: Competitive salary scale.
Additional paid time off over the Christmas/New Year Holidays.
Affordable Gym membership.
Comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental, and vision care.
Flexible Work Hours and a healthy work/life balance.
The ability to work alongside an international and diverse team.
Ubisoft is committed to enriching players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experience.
We create worlds where people can express themselves, explore and discover new possibilities.

Are you looking to work with enthusiastic experts who are tackling game-changing challenges in entertainment and beyond? At Ubisoft, we offer an open environment where bright ideas are given a chance to shine and everyone is eager to share knowledge.
Challenge Accepted? Join us and create the unknown!.

subtitle: Studio Description
body: Our studio is located in the heart of the city (Halifax) within the historic and iconic Keith's Brewery Market.
The Halifax Harbour is in view from our windows and lunch breaks can be spent on the boardwalk or at one of the many resturants and cafes that populate the downtown core.
The studio culture is dynamic and cooperative, with communication between teams and an emphasis on team-building!.

subtitle: We Value Diversity!
body: Here at Ubisoft, we offer an open environment where bright ideas are given a chance to shine and everyone is eager to lend a helping hand.
We are committed to creating a diverse environment and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
